channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX

item.title: Report E-2025020256
item.description:
Report E-2025020256

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-19
  • City: IRVING
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 19, 2025, eight (8) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed and released approximately two (2) gallons to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services who dispatched a crew from LoneStar Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the site. LSH removed all damaged product and placed them into one (1) 85-gallon overpack . LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2025020839
item.description:
Report X-2025020839

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-11
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. 1 fiberboard box containing 4 plastic spray pump bottles (30 oz each) of Oxi-Clean + Bleach (Mold &Mildew, No Drip Foam). 1 bottle leaked from the top/cap. All remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum and held for FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2025020236
item.description:
Report E-2025020236

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-19T06:18:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-14
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 13, 2025, two (2) 5-gallon pails of paint were punctured and released approximately 0.25-gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the site. The crew utilized cleaning agents and absorbents to remove the released paint. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 15-gallon drum and the damaged pails were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025020212
item.description:
Report E-2025020212

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-17T21:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-15
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6150
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering gasoline into the customer's storage tank. During the course of the delivery, a vehicle drove through the coned off delivery area and struck the hose adaptor. This caused the connection between the hose adaptor and storage tank to become compromised. Approximately 50 gallons of gasoline was released. ES&H Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
